column115: Charts and Data Welcome to CoinMarketCap.com! This site was founded in May 2013 by Brandon Chez to provide up-to-date cryptocurrency prices
column116: charts and data about the emerging cryptocurrency markets. Since then
column117: the world of blockchain and cryptocurrency has grown exponentially and we are very proud to have grown with it. We take our data very seriously and we do not change our data to fit any narrative: we stand for accurately
column118: timely and unbiased information. All Your Crypto Market Data Needs in One Place Here at CoinMarketCap
column119: we work very hard to ensure that all the relevant and up-to-date information about cryptocurrencies
column120: coins and tokens can be located in one easily discoverable place. From the very first day
column121: the goal was for the site to be the number one location online for crypto market data
column122: and we work hard to empower our users with our unbiased and accurate information. We Provide Live and Historic Crypto Charts for Free Each of our coin data pages has a graph that shows both the current and historic price information for the coin or token. Normally
column123: the graph starts at the launch of the asset
column124: but it is possible to select specific to and from dates to customize the chart to your own needs. These charts and their information are free to visitors of our website. How Do We Calculate Our Cryptocurrency Prices? We receive updated cryptocurrency prices directly from many exchanges based on their pairs. We then convert the number to USD. A full explanation can be found here. Related Links New to crypto? Learn how to buy bitcoin today. Ready to learn more? Visit our crypto glossary and Learning hub. Want to look up a transaction? Visit our blockchain explorer. How Do We Calculate Our Crypto Valuations? We calculate our valuations based on the total circulating supply of an asset multiplied by the currency reference price. The topic is explained in more detail here. How Do We Calculate the Cryptocurrency Market Cap? We calculate the total cryptocurrency market capitalization as the sum of all cryptocurrencies listed on the site. Does CoinMarketCap.com List All Cryptocurrencies? No
column125: we do not list all cryptocurrencies at CoinMarketCap. As a company and team
column126: we are very aware that not all coins and projects have good intentions. While we cannot guarantee to exclude them all
column127: we have a vetting process that each coin goes through before it is listed on the site. If we suspect that a coin or project is a scam
column128: it does not get listed. How Big Is the Global Coin Market? At the time of writing
column129: we estimate that there are around 8
column131: tokens and projects in the global coin market. As mentioned above
column132: we have a due diligence process that we apply to new coins before they are listed. This process controls how many of the cryptocurrencies from the global market are represented on our site. What Is an Altcoin? The very first cryptocurrency was Bitcoin. Since it is open source
column133: it is possible for other people to use the majority of the code
column134: make a few changes and then launch their own separate currency. Many people have done exactly this. Some of these coins are very similar to Bitcoin
column135: with just one or two amended features (such as Litecoin)
column139: they all share the same moniker â€” every coin issued after Bitcoin is considered to be an altcoin. What Is an ICO? ICO stands for initial coin offering. Many of the smaller projects in the crypto space â€” and a few of the largest ones â€” raised money from private investors around the world in the crypto equivalent of a crowdfunding campaign. Investors would send funds â€” usually in the form of Bitcoin â€” to the project and receive coin or tokens in return. Most ICOs happened in 2017 and early 2018 and used Ethereum as a platform of operation via the ERC-20 standard. In 2018
column140: the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) clarified their rules relating to fundraising for assets
column141: which made it much harder for new cryptocurrency projects to issue their own tokens in this way. Since the appearance of the SEC guidance and the organizationâ€™s heightened interest in regulating ICOs for U.S. citizens
column142: the number of ICOs has been reduced substantially. What Is a Stablecoin? Price volatility has long been one of the features of the cryptocurrency market. When asset prices move quickly in either direction and the market itself is relatively thin
column143: it can sometimes be difficult to conduct transactions as might be needed. To overcome this problem
column144: a new type of cryptocurrency tied in value to existing currencies â€” ranging from the U.S. dollar
column145: other fiats or even other cryptocurrencies â€” arose. These new cryptocurrency are known as stablecoins
column146: and they can be used for a multitude of purposes due to their stability. What Are In-game Tokens? Play-to-earn (P2E) games
column148: has emerged as an extremely popular category in the crypto space. It combines non-fungible tokens (NFT)
column150: decentralized finance (DeFi) elements and sometimes even metaverse applications. Players have an opportunity to generate revenue by giving their time (and sometimes capital) and playing these games. One of the biggest winners is Axie Infinity â€” a PokÃ©mon-inspired game where players collect Axies (NFTs of digital pets)
column151: breed and battle them against other players to earn Smooth Love Potion (SLP) â€” the in-game reward token. This game was extremely popular in developing countries like The Philippines
column152: due to the decent income they can earn. Players in the Philippines can check the price of SLP to PHP today directly on CoinMarketCap. Which Is the Best Cryptocurrency to Invest in? CoinMarketCap does not offer financial or investment advice about which cryptocurrency
column153: token or asset does or does not make a good investment
column154: nor do we offer advice about the timing of purchases or sales. We are strictly a data company. Please remember that the prices
column155: yields and values of financial assets change. This means that any capital you may invest is at risk. We recommend seeking the advice of a professional investment advisor for guidance related to your personal circumstances. If You Are Investing in Cryptocurrency â€” CoinMarketCap.com Is for You The data at CoinMarketCap updates throughout the day
column156: which means that it is possible to check in on the value of your investments and assets at any time and from anywhere in the world. We look forward to seeing you regularly! Be the first to know about crypto news every day Get crypto analysis
